title: How high can a Shaolin monk jump? - Quora

response.answer_text: 6 inches, or the the metrically cognizant, 15 cm. A Shaolin monk can easly jump 15 cm, although, I am fairly certain, there are some that can jump higher. Unfortunately, your question lacks the necessary information. Do you mean a standing vertical jump? Or a running vertical jump? The world record for a vertical jump onto a platform is 63.5″ by Evan Ungar of Canada and unofficially, Kevin Bania has a video of one at 64.5". Videos on YouTube, sorry Ican't link them here.

They jump very good, from what I know from the movie “Hon Guil Don” from the early 90-s, i think if you try to jump all the time you can reach some proficiency sooner or later )))But I suppose the best of all shaolin monks ever was Serhiy Bubka, who jumped 10 meters high. Yeah. Trust me on that.
